cyclone.name: OLGA
cyclone.current_location: about 320 mi SSW of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating north-northeast across the north-western Gulf, expected to cross the northern Gulf Coast tonight, then race northeastward through the Lower Mississippi Valley and Ohio Valley toward the lower Great Lakes
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Gulf Coast near central Louisiana

weather_observation.watch_coast: No tropical cyclone watches posted for any coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: No tropical cyclone warnings posted for any coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: northern Gulf Coast to the western Great Lakes, including the Ohio Valley
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds 20–30 mph possible Sunday as the post-tropical low passes
weather_observation.storm_surge: None (inland Lake Erie port; no oceanic surge)
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible on Sunday with locally higher amounts in downpours
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief urban or small-stream flooding potential
